intro: Struthanthus cupulifer, commonly known as the cup-bearing struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescences that resemble small, cup-like structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. Struthanthus cupulifer is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
